definitions.definition: To repeat (an activity) as a way of improving one's skill in that activity.
examples: You should practise playing piano every day.

definitions.definition: To repeat an activity in this way.
examples: If you want to speak French well, you need to practise .

definitions.definition: To perform or observe in an habitual fashion.
examples: They gather to practise religion every Saturday.

definitions.definition: To pursue (a career , especially law , fine art or medicine ).
examples: She practised law for forty years before retiring.

definitions.definition: To put into practice; to carry out; to act upon; to commit; to execute; to do.
To make use of; to employ.
To teach or accustom by practice; to train.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To repeat (an activity) as a way of improving one's skill in that activity.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To repeat an activity in this way.
( transitive ) To perform or observe in an habitual fashion.
( transitive ) To pursue (a career , especially law , fine art or medicine ).
To put into practice; to carry out; to act upon; to commit; to execute; to do.
To make use of; to employ.
To teach or accustom by practice; to train.
